metadata.title: Zitationsnetzwerk: Digital Humanities Methodendiskurs
metadata.description: Zehn Publikationen aus drei Forschungsclustern mit Zitationsbeziehungen

publications.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
publications.abstract: Introduces the concept of paradigm shifts in science. Argues that scientific progress is not linear but characterized by revolutionary changes in worldview.

publications.title: Graphs, Maps, Trees: Abstract Models for Literary History
publications.abstract: Introduces visual abstractions for analyzing literary history. Demonstrates network analysis and geographic mapping of literary phenomena.

publications.title: A Companion to Digital Humanities
publications.abstract: Foundational collection defining the field of digital humanities. Covers history, theory, and methods across disciplines.

publications.title: Digital Research in the Study of Classical Antiquity
publications.abstract: Applies digital methods to classical studies. Focuses on epigraphic databases and textual encoding.

publications.title: The Digital Humanities Manifesto 2.0
publications.abstract: Programmatic statement on the future of digital humanities. Emphasizes collaboration, openness, and interdisciplinarity.

publications.title: From Hermeneutics to Data to Networks: Data Extraction and Network Visualization of Historical Sources
publications.abstract: Systematic introduction to network analysis for historians and literary scholars. Covers centrality measures, community detection, and visualization.

publications.title: Digital Scholarly Editing: Theories, Models and Methods
publications.abstract: Examines the theoretical foundations of digital scholarly editing. Discusses TEI encoding and interface design for editions.

publications.title: Debates in the Digital Humanities
publications.abstract: Collection of essays on contested topics in digital humanities. Addresses questions of disciplinary identity and institutional politics.

publications.title: Visualization in Stylometry: Cluster Analysis Using Networks
publications.abstract: Applies stylometric analysis to classical authorship attribution. Demonstrates statistical methods on Greek tragedy corpus.

publications.title: Exploring Big Historical Data: The Historian's Macroscope
publications.abstract: Practical guide to computational methods for historians. Covers text mining, topic modeling, and network analysis with tutorials.
